td.p: Description of reaction: Ms. Critchard has an allergic reaction to Amoxicillin, which presents as an urticarial rash in the form of a generalized severe rash.
Probability of recurrence: She first experienced a reaction aged 12 and probability of recurrence is likely.

tr.td:
Dear Dr. O'Reilly,
Thank you for referring Ms. Critchard to the gastroenterology outpatient clinic.
Appointment to be made at a later date
Findings are suggestive of IBD. Rigid sigmoidoscopy looks like UC. 5ASA treatment commenced today pending further investigation.
Canvas Health Centre - Organisation ID: A111111
The abdomen was found to be soft but mainly tender in the left iliac fossa. There was no guarding or rebound and bowel sounds normal.
Ms. Critchard has no family history of I.B.D.
Canvas Health Centre, 27, Acacia Road, BM9 6PM

Ms. Critchard presents with ongoing symptoms of bloody diarrhoea, weight loss, and abdominal discomfort that are unresponsive to treatment. She has a 2 month history of bloody diarrhoea. Her bowels open 5-6 times per day with 1-2 nocturnal episodes. Ms. Critchard has experienced weight loss of 1 stone over the same period. She experiences a crampy left iliac fossa pain intermittently.
She has no history of travel, unwell contacts or previous similar symptoms. She has longstanding mild dyspepsia for which she takes antacid as necessary. It has never been investigated.
(only changes to medications and medical devices as a result of the outpatient encounter are included)
Dose directions description: To be taken orally once a day as 3x800mg tablets.
Comment: A 14xday course was prescribed in clinic, please renew in 2xweeks time. It is expected that this will aid symptom management.

A flexible sigmoidoscopy has been requested on an urgent basis by Ruth Jones on 01/05/17. FBC, U and E, LFT and CRP are to be measured, the patient was provided with a form at the appointment. Stool MC and S plus C. diff are to be taken, the patient was given forms and collection points at the appointment.

Rigid sigmoidoscopy
Comment: A Rigid sigmoidoscopy was performed to the limit of view at 20cm. It showed inflamed and ulcerated mucosa with contact bleeding to about 15cm. Proximally appears to improve. Performed by Ruth Jones, 1 May 2017.

td.p: Organisation: Canvas Health Centre, 27 Acacia Road, BM9 6PM

tr.td: Ms. Critchard lives with her boyfriend.
Ms. Critchard works as a Baker.
She is an ex-smoker, stopped 2 years.
She consumes 10-14 units of alcohol per week.

display.value: Appointment to be made at a later date

Usual place of residence unless listed below, for example, a private dwelling whether owner occupied or owned by Local Authority, housing association or other landlord. This includes wardened accommodation but not residential accommodation where health care is provided. It also includes Patients with no fixed abode.
Generalised skin eruption caused by drug and medicament
On examination - left iliac fossa tender

text.value: Procedure showed inflamed and ulcerated mucosa with contact bleeding to about 15cm. Proximally appears to improve.
2.4mg per day of Asacol in tablet form, to be taken orally once a day as 3x800mg tablets.
